item.title: Meshes, Voxels, NURBS and T-Splines
item.author: karanlohaan0@gmail.com (Karan Lohaan)
item.description:
While learning CAD basics I stumbled upon various CAD specific surface modelling primitives like NURBS and T Splines. Ive tried to demystify some aspects of these surface representing functions here.

Newer Perspectives

The main motivation for going down this deep dive of understanding CAD surfaces was mainly because it is really different from other forms of representing 3d models that rely on using a set of discrete points, triangles, polygons.

I also wanted to check for their viability for representing 3d models in a more compressed/continuous manner as storing a set of points/triangles/polygons as a set of functions could be beneficial if we’re talking about general regular geometry based objects. u
